basics.name: Marno Kulmala
basics.label: Lead Software Engineer and hands-on Software Architect
basics.summary:
I'm an expert in Java based technologies (but I'm also fluent with many other programming languages) and in information technology overall: SW architectures, databases, DevOps + SysOps and testing. Agile methods have been in my toolbox for years now and I'm trying out new technologies by developing all sorts of apps in my free time. At the moment I'm using my own time to  learn AI, more about python and trying out zig. 
After years developing with Java I moved to C++ to see new horizons. My most recent experience is from maritime industry. My long term goal is to be one of the creators of future: Games, AI, robotics, fintech and industrial development are close to my heart. Specialties: Systems development, backend technologies (C/C++, Java, python), DevOps, Cloud platforms and SW architectures

work.name: Mavericks Software Oy
highlights: Fintech development related to PCI and open banking
work.summary: Worked as consultant in Senior/Lead Java developer roles in different industries: Public Sector, fintech, telecom, OEM. Also involved doing technical interviews for possible candidates for joining Mavericks. Tech stack used: Java (JVM8-17, Eclipse Leshan and LwM2M protocol, device control, Kubernetes + prometheus, Spring, Spring Boot, Wicket, JavaFX, troubleshooting in all forms, flyway, lombok, hibernate, ehcache, java profiling and optimizing with JProfiler and JMC/JCMD), jdeps for module hunting, Integrations (REST, SOAP, main frames), Containers (Docker, Kubernetes), Cloud (openstack, AWS), Databases (DB2, Postgres, triggers, procedures etc), Devops (shell scripting, automation, CI, ansible, yaml, Jenkins, artifactory), Embedded (Hardware debugging, basics of yocto distros, devices, IoT), System testing with robot framework, Prototyping and learning: Quarkus, MongoDB, Kotlin, nodejs and react, requirements engineering. Industries: Educational services, fintech (PSD2, monetising, PCI), authentication

work.name: PHZ Full Stack

Worked as a senior consultant in Java and DevOps problems in many industries (fintech, idm, telecom). Java consultation problems related to: Java, Graphql, flyway, RxJava, Spring, microservices, Groovy + Grails, xml technologies
Devops consultation involved: Jenkins, ansible, terraform, flocker, openstack, aws, docker, artifactory, *nix, scripting (bash, python), marathon, mesos, developing and maintaining Platform as a Service

work.name: Multiple Companies
highlights: Worked as software architect in many industries
work.summary: Worked as software architect for couple of companies. Projects included asset management related development, electronic case management and public sector. Mostly Maximo cases, but others as well. Other tasks include architectural decisions, helping other team members in development issues, refining software engineering processes used on daily work and designing better ways to implement things. Technologies: JEE, Web Services (REST, SOAP), Spring, jython, virtualization, windows, linux, db2, WebSphere, redmine, integrations, Talend Open Studio, JEE, Apache ServiceMix, MySql, IntelliJ, Liferay, xml-technologies, python and tesseract, Spring, Oracle DB, Oracle SOA, Weblogic, htlm5 with responsive.css, JavaFX and knockdown.js

work.name: Protacon Group
highlights: Worked as lead developer in vehicle maintenance project
work.summary: Worked as a consultant in Business development as well as R&D tasks related to software engineering and planning software architectures. Acted as lead developer and Scrum mastering. I was also involved in mentoring: teaching other developers about new tech. Methodologies used: scrum, tdd. Technologies used: Javascript frameworks (mainly node.js but also jquery), Java (version 6 and 7: rest, resteasy, ejb3.X), Servers (Managing and installing: Win 2008 server, ubuntu), tech demos(nacl, kotlin, .net, drupal), orm (jpa2, mybatis), Stripes framework, jms, IBM MQ, Spring, Spring Integration

work.name: Houston Inc.
work.summary: Worked as a senior consultant in TeleOperator/TeleCom sector R&D and banking. Technologies used: Antlr, Wicket, GearMan, Guice, Mockito, JDave, Jetty, Resin, Web Services (SOAP), IDM, J2EE, Spring, maven, Struts, ibatis, Weblogic, xml, EJB, jsp, HTML + CSS + jQuery, php, XAMPP, postgres. Methodologies used: Scrum, kanban

work.name: Kodem

work.name: Tietoenator
highlights: Document management development and platform support
work.summary: Worked as a document management consultant: implementing and supporting client specific solutions. Technologies used: document management tools, Java, SQL, scripting, unix, admin tools (consoles, network statistics etc), tech support

work.name: Multiple Companies
work.summary: I worked more than three years as freelancer for couple of companies in Turku and in Pori. First I worked as MS Office teacher for Metso (part time job won from schools competition). Then I worked for Sysforte (nowadays belongs to SysOpen Digia) half an year or so. In Sysforte I worked as Visual Basic programmer for different projects. Mainly on applications that were used in industrial PC's: one of them was a in house ERP for customer. Last one was Affecto where I worked most of my time as freelancer. My job description was ICT designer which basically meant Document management solutions developer. In technical point of view this meant mainly ASP2+ (vbscript and JavaScript) webapplications and Visual Basic components. I also developed many integrations to other systems related to document management, example of these are autocad integration component and wintime integration component. Tech used: Windows, desktop development, JS, VB, VBA, ASP, T-SQL, PL/SQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, Document management, Barcode scanning, Sticker printers, Document scanning (Kofax, OCR etc)

certificates.name: IBM Tivoli Enterprise Asset Management Sales Professional v3

references.name: Juha Simola
references.reference: Marno is an easy-going person, there are no dull moments when having him as a teammate. Creates a relaxed and open atmosphere. Has strong talent, seniority and vision in Java development. Communicates openly about possible challenges and always finds time to work for the team, thus helping to create or maintain a psychologically safe culture within the team he is working in.

references.name: Artturi Laitakari
references.reference: Marno is highly focused problem solver with very high talent for analysing and making things happen. Marno is a great addition to any team.

references.name: Jussi Metso
references.reference: Marno is a good team player and does his tasks well. I would recommend Marno to any kind of Information Technology job. Documentum products and Java are the specialities for Marno.

projects.name: Mobile game development training
projects.description: Teaching Flutter development to junior developer by creating mobile games. Final outcome is a game demo ready for future development and improvements

projects.name: Remote vessel
projects.description: Remote vessel operations backend development using TypeScript, C++ and gRPC for large Maritime industry company. Tasks also included creating dockerized gRPC Web prototype as proof-of-concept and testing library with Typescript and Jest
highlights: Created dockerized gRPC Web prototype as proof-of-concept
Created testing library with Typescript and Jest

projects.name: Wifi measurement system development
projects.description: Wifi measurement system development with Java and JavaFX. Huge desktop application with several views and multi-threaded asynchronous calculations. Tasks included using JProfiler to find memory leaks, debugging multi-threaded application, prototyping and application updates to newer JVM version

projects.name: Road weather station
projects.description: Road weather station development with Java and Spring running in embedded environment. Tested and implemented Lightweight M2M for system update with Leshan and implemented better way to upload files by enabling download restarting in case of network problems
highlights: Tested and implemented Lightweight M2M for system update with Leshan
Implemented better way to upload files by enabling download restarting in case of network problems
